Title: Beef Hash Browns - Breakfast: 5. Add the onion and garlic powder. Stir and cook for an additional 2 minutes.

Title: Beef Hash Browns - Breakfast: 8. Add the paprika and stir to combine.
9. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
10. Take about 1/2 cup of the beef hash mixture and press it firmly into a patty shape.
11. Fry each patty for 3-4 minutes on each side until they are golden brown and cooked through.
12. Remove each patty from the skillet and place it on a paper towel-lined plate to drain off any excess oil.
13. Serve the hash brown patties warm with your favorite breakfast sides. Enjoy!
Title: Baked eggs with Bacon and Tomatoes - Breakfast
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
2. Place two bacon strips in an oven-safe skillet. Cook the bacon until it is crispy. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set it aside.
3. Cut the tomatoes into small cubes and set aside.
4. Remove any excess bacon fat from the skillet. Place the skillet back into the oven for about 5 minutes to heat it up.
5. Carefully crack the eggs into the skillet
ensuring they do not touch each other.

Title: Beef Hash Browns - Breakfast: 7. Place the bacon strips on top of the eggs.
8. Bake the eggs in the oven for about 15 minutes
or until the whites are set and the yolks are still slightly runny.

2. Use a whisk to scramble the eggs until the yolks and whites are blended.
3. Heat a pan on medium heat and add 1 teaspoon of butter.

transfer them onto the toast and season with salt and pepper to taste.
